required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Evidence-Based Quality Improvement of Comprehensive Women's Health Care Implementation in Low-Performing VA Facilities
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Evidence-Based Quality Improvement of Comprehensive Women's Health Care Implementation in Low-Performing VA Facilities (PEC 16-352)

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Dynamic waitlist control design with seven VA facilities randomly allocated to Evidence-Based Quality Improvement (EBQI) in Year 1 (with 14 VA facilities serving as waitlist controls), a second seven VA facilities randomly allocated to EBQI in Year 2 (with 7 remaining VA facilities continuing to serve as waitlist controls), and the final 7 VA facilities getting EBQI in Year 3 (no waitlist controls remaining).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 12-month change in gender-sensitivity of care environment
primary_outcome.description: Multi-item scale score reflecting survey items on availability of same-gender providers, availability of same-gender staff, privacy of physical layout, availability of privacy curtains, level of implementation of local culture campaign to reduce harassment

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24-month change in gender-sensitivity of care environment
primary_outcome.description: Multi-item scale score reflecting survey items on availability of same-gender providers, availability of same-gender staff, privacy of physical layout, availability of privacy curtains, level of implementation of local culture campaign to reduce harassment using practice surveys and key stakeholder interviews

primary_outcome.time_frame: 12-month change in gender awareness among VA personnel
primary_outcome.description: Multi-item scale score reflecting survey items among providers and staff in primary care and women's health settings that reflect awareness and knowledge of women Veterans' military roles and healthcare needs

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24-month change in gender awareness among VA personnel
primary_outcome.description: Multi-item scale score reflecting survey items among providers and staff in primary care and women's health settings that reflect awareness and knowledge of women Veterans' military roles and healthcare needs using web-based provider and staff surveys
Completion of one or more quality improvement projects related to women Veterans' health and/or healthcare improvement through project logs and key stakeholder interviews
Completion of one or more quality improvement projects related to women Veterans' health and/or healthcare improvement through project logs and key stakeholder interviews

Multi-item scale score from provider and staff surveys in primary care and women's health settings (including training, best practices, use of VA performance data, use of VA survey data, small tests of change)

Multi-item scale score from provider and staff surveys in primary care and women's health settings (including training, best practices, use of VA performance data, use of VA survey data, small tests of change) and from key stakeholder interviews

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-month change in gender-specific preventive care delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Composite measure of gender-specific preventive services (i.e., breast and cervical cancer screening rates) using the VA External Peer Review Program (EPRP) chart-based quality metrics and Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW) derived quality metrics

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24-month change in gender-specific preventive care delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Composite measure of gender-specific preventive services (i.e., breast and cervical cancer screening rates) using the VA External Peer Review Program (EPRP) chart-based quality metrics and Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW) derived quality metrics

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12-month change in quality of care ratings
secondary_outcome.description: Aggregated measures of women Veterans' ratings of VA care quality using CAHPS/PCMH/SHEPs (Survey of Healthcare Experiences for Patients) data aggregated to the facility level

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24-month change in quality of care ratings
secondary_outcome.description: Aggregated measures of women Veterans' ratings of VA care quality using CAHPS/PCMH/SHEPs (Survey of Healthcare Experiences for Patients) data aggregated to the facility level
Women Veterans' ratings of accessibility using a previously validated and reliable survey items and mean scale score from CAHPS/PCMH/SHEPs (Survey of Healthcare Experiences for Patients)
Women Veterans' ratings of accessibility using a previously validated and reliable survey items and mean scale score from CAHPS/PCMH/SHEPs (Survey of Healthcare Experiences for Patients)
Women Veterans' ratings of care coordination using a previously validated and reliable survey items and mean scale scores from CAHPS/PCMH/SHEPs (Survey of Healthcare Experiences for Patients)
Women Veterans' ratings of care coordination using a previously validated and reliable survey items and mean scale scores from CAHPS/PCMH/SHEPs (Survey of Healthcare Experiences for Patients)

Percentage of women Veterans' obtaining recommended preventive care based on eligibility for service (e.g., meet eligibility guidelines for colorectal cancer screening) using VA External Peer Review Program chart-based quality metrics and Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW) quality metrics

Percentage of women Veterans' obtaining recommended preventive care based on eligibility for service (e.g., meet eligibility guidelines for colorectal cancer screening) using VA External Peer Review Program chart-based quality metrics and Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW) quality metrics

secondary_outcome.measure: Assignment to a designated women's health provider
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women Veterans assigned to a designated women's health provider in a general primary care and/or women's health primary care setting

secondary_outcome.measure: Assignment to a designated women's health provider
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of women Veterans assigned to a designated women's health provider in a general primary care and/or women's health primary care setting
Aggregated score of PACT features implemented since baseline using practice surveys and key stakeholder interviews
Aggregated score of PACT features implemented since baseline using practice surveys and key stakeholder interviews

arm_group.description: EBQI represents a multilevel stakeholder engaged top-down/bottom-up research-clinical partnership approach to systematically improving the design and implementation of local innovations adapted to local contexts. The EBQI contractor will (1) convene facility-level stakeholder meetings, (2) facilitate local facility-level QI team design meetings, (3) provide external practice facilitation through within and across facility QI collaboration calls, (4) provide formative QI data feedback and (5) provide QI training/education to local teams.
Waitlist controls will continue naturalistic routine care implementation of VHA directives and other guidance related to comprehensive women's health care.

intervention.description: Multilevel research-clinical partnership approach to supporting local strategic planning, priority setting, skill building and engagement in addressing targeted healthcare delivery problems. Launched at participating VA facilities through advance key stakeholder interviews, in-person site visits, data review (e.g., structure and environment of care, gender disparities in quality and patient experience), QI education/training, technical support (e.g., QI project and measures development), additional formative feedback from the evaluation (e.g., provider/survey measure summaries), external and internal practice facilitation, and across-EBQI site collaboration calls. Local leadership, EBQI champions and QI teams develop and implement innovation projects aimed at improving prioritized quality targets related to women Veterans' health and healthcare needs as well as facility-level structural changes needed to improve compliance with VA guidelines.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unit of randomization: VA healthcare facilities (VA medical center or community-based outpatient clinic)
- Subset of VA healthcare facilities identified as low-performing on the basis of composites of access/wait times, gender disparities in quality, e.g.:
- depression screening
- diabetic blood sugar control
- Presence/absence of VA-required structural facets of care, e.g.:
- designated women's health providers
- mammography coordinator
- gynecology access
- Women Veteran Program Manager
- 3:1 staffing ratio for PACT teamlets
Key Stakeholder Inclusion Criteria (qualitative interviews):
- VISN level leader (Director or Chief Medical Officer)
- VISN level WVPM Lead, VISN level primary care director, VISN level QI/system redesign lead)
- VA facility leader (Director or other quadrad member)
- Chief of Staff
- primary care director
- women's health medical director
- WVPM
- local EBQI champion
- other key personnel
Provider/Staff Survey Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary care providers (MD, DO, NP, PA) delivering primary care in general primary care and/or women's health clinics
- PACT teamlet members (RN care managers, LVN/LPN/health technicians, and clerks)
- larger PACT team members, e.g.:
- social workers
- dieticians
- health coaches
- integrated mental health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Facility-level exclusion: Facilities not identified in the initial sample of VA facilities (sample not renewed over time).
